entry.title: Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017) (3)20180113
I played the next level in about 75m and did pretty well. I did my
same strategy but right at the end, before giving the killing
blow, I made sure that all the enemies were dead so I could get
more gold.

GP: 2900gp

It took almost the same amount of time to play the next level. I
spawned two really hard monsters --- the Gargoyle and the Giant
Ape. My party ended up split up two, with the Paladin far away. It
worked out okay though, because I rushed to open up
territory. (The win condition was just to get a particular room to
spawn.) It was pretty tense and very fun!

GP: 4400gp

I used my gold to get the Ranger and Paladin to the next
level. This seems like the best thing to do at this stage of the
game and then start stacking up the advancements afterwards.

GP: 400gp

Total time: 6:01
  • Video Games
  • Tomb of Annihilation
  • Board
  • 2017

entry.title: Game: Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Final Mix (PS3, 2013) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Final Mix (PS3, 2013) (2)20180112
I played up to the boss battle in Wonderland and found it so
aggravating. The fetch quests and awkward combat. I can see why I
liked this when I was younger because it doesn't really take much
skill to do the fights and so it makes the time-for-power trade of
most RPGs. I enjoyed the theme at that time, but now it is just
ho-hum and the graphics aren't nice enough to make it worth
it. Sad that a game I really loved when I was younger doesn't hold
up anymore.

Total time: 2:50
  • Video Games
  • Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Final Mix
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Re:Chain of Memories (PS3, 2013)
entry.content:
Game: Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Re:Chain of Memories (PS3, 2013)20180112
I heard of this game when it came out but at the time I basically
was never buying portable games. It seems very intriguing, and
while I could care less about the story, the battle system seems
really interesting. Part of me suspects that the original 2D
battle system would actually work better, but I am going to play
this for a bit.

Total time: 0:27
  • Video Games
  • Kingdom Hearts 1.5 HD Remix: Kingdom Hearts Re:Chain of Memories
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Mega Man 9 (PS3, 2008) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man 9 (PS3, 2008) (3)20180112
I played each of the stages again for a bit and was so thoroughly
creamed I've given up. I feel sad to give up but it is just so
frustrating. I feel like when they tried to make a new old game
they forgot that the old games were hard but fair, maybe?

Total time: 1:24

entry.title: Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017) (2)20180112
I played the second adventure and was very successful---I didn't
use any healing surges. I took a different approach in two
ways. First, I made sure that every round it was possible, I
expanded the tiles available. This made it so there were far fewer
encounters and thus I got to the ending much fast. Next, I knew
that it would be relatively short, so I was much more willing to
use my Daily powers. I managed to take out the final boss pretty
quickly. It was really fun and much more tactically
interesting. It was funny though because I didn't expect to win so
quickly. I didn't get as much treasure though. I think I will save
my gold and upgrade to Level 2 as soon as I can. I did
misunderstand something about how treasure works though---when you
go to the Marketplace, you ignore non-Item cards. That makes
things much much nicer.

GP: 1600gp

Total time: 3:21
  • Video Games
  • Tomb of Annihilation
  • Board
  • 2017

entry.title: Book: The Areas of My Expertise, by John Hodgman (2005)
entry.content:
Book: The Areas of My Expertise, by John Hodgman (2005)20180112
I listened to the audio book of this while playing some games and
had a blast. It is so silly. I love how the audio book version has
all sorts of conversation between Hodgman and Coulton, but I think
the best part was Paul Rudd's jokes.
  • Books
  • 2005

entry.title: Movie: Before Midnight, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Before Midnight, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (2013)20180111
This was very cute, and although very different than the others, I
could see what they were trying to do. The first ones were a kind
of realistic-fantasy about one stage of life in a couple and this
tried to really show what married life was like and how soul mates
like Jesse and Celine would deal with their problems. I enjoyed
it. I had to close my eyes for the awkwardly long segment when
Celine was topless though!
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Taken, starring Liam Neeson (2008)
entry.content:
Movie: Taken, starring Liam Neeson (2008)20180111
I had a hankerin' to watch this movie and it did not disappoint at
all. It is so intense. I love it. I think the most hardcore scene
is when he catches the guy, "Good luck" and then when he shoots the
French guy's wife, woah!

entry.title: Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017)
entry.content:
Game: Tomb of Annihilation (Board, 2017)20180110
I played the first adventure with three characters and it took two
hours, including setup, clean up, and reading the rules. It was
fun and pretty tense. I was expecting there to be like a "boss" at
the end, so I saved my Daily powers longer than I should have. I
used both Healing Surges and it was really exciting. There wasn't
as much strategy as I'd hoped, it is more about mitigating risk
and avoiding putting yourself out there.

I played with three players and was surprised that there were no
rules for balancing, but then after playing for a while, I
realized that more players will naturally lead to more enemies
being discovered and/or more encounters happening. I never had it
happen where two players at the same monster card, but I was quite
nervous about it, because that would really be painful. It is very
interesting that the monsters "teleport" into your spot. It makes
it so there's no way to cheese their AI by moving them around in a
stupid way.

So far, I like the game!

Ranger
Bard
Paladin
---
GP: 500

Total time: 2:03
  • Video Games
  • Tomb of Annihilation
  • Board
  • 2017

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster) (PS3, 2014) (13)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster) (PS3, 2014) (13)20180109
I played through all bu the last few bosses. I went back and got
the Dark Knight and started to do some grinding in the Farplane. I
find this game to be pretty good but too full of junk to be super
interested in it. If the side quests were not so weird and tedious
(i.e. if it were more fighting and not so much strange puzzle
solving) then I think I enjoy the combat system enough to want to
do it, but I don't enjoy the system so much that I want to put
myself through it. I watched the endings on YouTube and it was
okay. The story of the game isn't that meaningful though because
it feels so unnecessary relative to FFX.

Total time: 22:17
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 10 2 (HD Remaster)
  • PS3
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Before Sunset, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (2004)
entry.content:
Movie: Before Sunset, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (2004)20180109
I love that this takes place in real time. It is very interesting
how they made the personalities come alive and grow off screen in a
believable way. The challenges of youth become challenges of middle
age, it is very cute.
  • Movies
  • 2004

entry.title: Movie: Before Sunrise, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (1995)
entry.content:
Movie: Before Sunrise, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy (1995)20180109
This movie was so cute and romantic. I loved how it was just one
long conversation. It reminded my wife and I so much of each other
because we had long real conversations when we first met.
  • Movies
  • 1995

entry.title: Movie: Baby Driver, starring Ansel Elgort (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: Baby Driver, starring Ansel Elgort (2017)20180108
This movie was filled with style and cleverness. I really liked it
a lot. The driving scenes were just amazing and the musical moments
were great. Lily James was essentially characterless, but quite
cute in her role.
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 2 - Episode 7 - A Man Without Honor (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 2 - Episode 7 - A Man Without Honor (4)20180108
Jaime is so terrible in this. We haven't seen him in a while and
you really don't like his actions. Dany's scenes were
intense... the first time I watched I didn't understand that the
Sorcerer wants her because dragons have made his magic
real. Theon's words are so prescient of what happens to
him. Ygritte steals her scenes with Jon. Sansa's tragedy
continues. I really enjoyed Arya's scene as well.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.content:
